marketNews.title: Trump Opens Negotiations with China, Rupiah Strengthens to 16,173
marketNews.content:
The rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar strengthened by +0.66% to the level of 16,173 on Friday (24/1), marking the fifth consecutive day of gains and appreciating by a total of +1.17% WoW. Besides the rupiah, the currencies of several other emerging market countries also strengthened against the US dollar over the past week as of Friday (24/1), such as the Malaysian ringgit (+3.05% WoW), the Thai baht (+2.34% WoW), and the Philippine peso (+0.48% WoW).

The strengthening of the rupiah exchange rate was driven by the easing of trade war risks between the US and China after the US President, Donald Trump, said on Thursday (23/1) that he could reach a fair trade deal with China. Trump mentioned that he had a conversation with Chinese President Xi Jinping last week before he was officially inaugurated as the US president on January 20, 2025. Trump stated that the conversation went well and was friendly.

Trump added that he preferred not to impose import tariffs on China. However, Trump emphasized that import tariffs are an extraordinary tool for the US to exert power over China.

Trump's statement came a few days after he said he would impose a 10% import tariff on China effective February 1, 2025, on the grounds that the country had supplied narcotics to the US via Canada and Mexico. Upon inauguration, Trump implemented a 25% import tariff policy for Canada and Mexico for the same reason. This threat of import tariffs for China was softer compared to Trump's campaign promise where he claimed he would impose up to 60% import tariffs on China upon taking office.

Market Strategist at Krung Thai Bank, Poon Panichpibool, told Reuters that Asian currency rates would strengthen and the US 10-year government bond yield would tend to stabilize/decrease as long as market participants remain convinced that the Trump administration will not immediately implement tariff hikes and the tariff amounts will not be as severe as previously feared.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content:
Investors need to closely monitor developments regarding US-China relations, given that these have the potential to impact the outlook for US inflation and interest rates. Therefore, we assess that the market will remain volatile until more concrete developments emerge.

For more conservative investors, you can consider short-term government bonds such as PBS003 which has a yield of 6.61% per year with a tenor of approximately 2 years. Meanwhile, investors with higher risk appetite can consider big bank stocks, such as BMRI and BBCA.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump's Global Economic Remarks
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on Thursday (23/1) asked Saudi Arabia and OPEC to lower oil prices, and demanded that interest rates immediately decrease worldwide. Trump also warned companies globally that they would face import tariffs if they produced products outside the US, although he did not elaborate further. Reuters reported that Trump's statement reinforced the message that his second term as US president would avoid free market norms both domestically and internationally.

marketNews.title: LPS Projects Third-Party Funds Growth and Economic Recovery Outlook
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Board of Commissioners of the Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS), Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, stated on Thursday (23/1) that LPS projects Third-Party Fund (DPK) growth around +6-7% YoY in 2025. Purbaya estimates that the domestic economy will begin to recover in mid-2Q25 in line with the commencement of new government programs and the expectation of improving global conditions. During 2024, LPS recorded that DPK growth only reached +4.21% YoY (vs. Dec 2023: +3.73% YoY), which was lower than LPS's previous projection of +6% YoY.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Government Requests Delay of Some LNG Exports to Meet Domestic Needs
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the Indonesian government has asked domestic liquefied natural gas (LNG) exporters to postpone shipments this year due to increasing domestic energy demand. Bloomberg sources stated that the Indonesian government requested an LNG export postponement until 2026. Other Bloomberg sources mentioned that Indonesia needs to postpone 50 LNG cargoes to offset the rise in domestic consumption. During 2024, Indonesia exported approximately 300 LNG cargoes.

marketNews.title: Bank of Japan Raises Benchmark Interest Rate
marketNews.content: The Bank of Japan on Friday (24/1) decided to raise its benchmark interest rate by +25 bps to the level of 0.5%, in line with consensus expectations, marking the highest level since October 2008. This decision was made as a policy normalization step along with inflation reaching 3.6% YoY in December 2024—exceeding the Bank of Japan's target of 2%—and an increase in worker wages.

marketNews.title: President's Instruction to Cut State Budget Expenditure
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto released a presidential instruction to cut state budget expenditures up to Rp 306.7 trillion, which consists of efficiency in the budget expenditure of ministries and institutions up to Rp 256.1 trillion and a cut in regional transfer budgets up to Rp 50.6 trillion. This cut amount is equivalent to 8% of the total expenditure in the 2025 State Budget. Ministry of Finance Spokesperson, Deni Surjantoro, stated that these cuts do not require a revision of the 2025 State Budget. This instruction to cut came a week after the Head of the National Nutrition Agency, Dadan Hindayana, stated that President Prabowo wants to accelerate the distribution of the free lunch program and targets as many as 82.9 million beneficiaries this year, requiring an additional budget of up to Rp 100 trillion.

marketNews.title: Government Accelerates Nuclear Power Plant Development Target
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Yuliot Tanjung, stated on Thursday (23/1) that the ministry intends to accelerate the development of nuclear power plants (PLTN) to 2029, which is 3 years faster than the initial target of 2032. The discourse on accelerating PLTN development is in line with the plan to increase national electricity capacity up to 443 GW in the National Electricity General Plan (RUKN) for the period 2025-2060, where 79% of this capacity is targeted to come from new and renewable energy sources. Nevertheless, Yuliot stated that no company has yet expressed interest in investing in nuclear energy in Indonesia because the PLTN is still in the assessment stage by the government.

tickerNews.title: CEO of PTRO Buys 550,000 Shares
tickerNews.content: PTRO: The President Director of Petrosea, Michael, purchased 550,000 shares of PTRO at an average price of 3,700 rupiah per share on January 20, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Michael's ownership in PTRO increased from 0.0139% to 0.0193%.

tickerNews.title: HGII Explores Acquisition of Mini-Hydropower Plants
tickerNews.content: HGII: The President Director of Hero Global Investment, Robin Sunyoto, stated that the company is studying the possibility of acquiring mini-hydro power plants (PLTM) that already have power purchase agreements with PLN but have not started commercial operation due to funding and technology capability constraints. Robin mentioned that they are looking at several potential PLTM companies for acquisition with capacities below 10 MW. This acquisition plan is part of the company's target to increase capacity up to 100 MW by 2031, in addition to organic expansion through the development of a 25 MW hydropower plant (PLTA) and a 10 MW PLTM, both targeted to operate in 2028. HGII currently operates 2 PLTM units with a total capacity of 19 MW through its subsidiary.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Targets Rp 5 Trillion Marketing Sales in 2025
tickerNews.content: SMRA: The Director of Summarecon Agung, Lydia Tjio, stated that the company targets marketing sales of Rp 5 trillion in 2025, unchanged from the 2024 target and +14.4% higher than the 2024 realization of Rp 4.37 trillion. SMRA has allocated capex of Rp 2 trillion in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: Rp 750 billion) intended for land acquisition and the development of malls and hotels.

tickerNews.title: CLEO Allocates Rp 600 Billion Capex for 2025 Expansion
tickerNews.content: CLEO: The President Director of Sariguna Primatirta, Melisa Patricia, stated that the company has allocated capex of Rp 600 billion in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: Rp 450 billion). These funds are intended to strengthen production and distribution capacity to support aggressive future growth. Previously, Melisa mentioned that CLEO in 2025 will open 3 new factories in Pekanbaru, Pontianak, and Palu, bringing the total number of the company's factories to 35. CLEO targets double-digit sales growth in 2025.

tickerNews.title: PWON Exceeds 2024 Marketing Sales Target
tickerNews.content: PWON: Pakuwon Jati recorded marketing sales of Rp 427.2 billion in 4Q24 (+20% QoQ, +26% YoY). This result brought marketing sales for 2024 to Rp 1.55 trillion (+16% YoY), exceeding the 2024 target of Rp 1.5 trillion by 104%. The condominium segment contributed 50% of 2024 marketing sales, followed by residential (46%) and office (4%). Marketing sales with PPN DTP incentives contributed 59% of total 2024 marketing sales.

tickerNews.title: Morgan Stanley Sells Shares in FILM
tickerNews.content: FILM: A shareholder of MD Entertainment, Morgan Stanley & Co. International plc, sold approximately 188.8 million FILM shares at an average price of 1,200 rupiah per share on January 15, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately Rp 226.5 billion. Following this transaction, Morgan Stanley & Co. International Plc's ownership in FILM decreased from ~13.42% to ~11.51%.

tickerNews.title: Esta Indonesia Shareholder Increases Stake in NEST
tickerNews.content: NEST: A shareholder of Esta Indonesia, Xiamen Yan Palace Birds Nest Industry Co. Ltd., purchased approximately 8.2 million NEST shares at an average price of 370 rupiah per share on January 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately Rp 3 billion. Following this transaction, Xiamen Yan Palace Birds Nest Industry Co. Ltd.'s ownership in NEST increased from 4.8% to 5%.
